meanings.definition: Soft and yielding to the touch.
meanings.sent1: The pillow felt squidgy when I rested my head on it.
meanings.sent2: The marshmallow was squidgy and melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent3: I love how squidgy the playdough feels between my fingers.
meanings.sent4: Her squidgy hug enveloped me in warmth and comfort.
meanings.sent5: The squidgy mud oozed between my toes as I walked through the field.

meanings.sent1: The squidgy mud made a squelching noise as I stepped in it.
meanings.sent2: The squidgy sponge soaked up the water with a squelching sound.
meanings.sent3: The squidgy tomatoes in the salad squelched when I cut into them.
meanings.sent4: The squidgy shoes squelched as I walked through the rain.
meanings.sent5: The squidgy snow under my boots squelched as I trudged through the winter storm.

meanings.definition: To press or squeeze something soft and yielding.
meanings.sent1: I squidgy the stress ball to relax my hands.
meanings.sent2: She squidgy the dough to shape it into cookies.
meanings.sent3: He squidgy the clay into different shapes for his art project.
meanings.sent4: They squidgy the sponge to clean the dishes after dinner.
meanings.sent5: We squidgy the playdough to create fun sculptures during art class.
